governing_body: Texas State Board of Plumbing Examiners

license_types.name: Tradesman Plumber-Limited
license_types.description: Entry-level license for basic plumbing work under supervision

license_types.name: Journeyman Plumber
license_types.description: Standard commercial and residential plumbing license

license_types.name: Master Plumber
license_types.description: Highest level - can supervise others, pull permits, run business
license_types.experience_required: 12,000 hours (minimum 4 years as Journeyman + 2 years additional)

requirements.education: High school diploma or GED recommended but not required

experience_breakdown.supervision: Must be under licensed Master Plumber

examination.reference_materials: IPC, UPC, Texas Plumbing License Law & Rules
examination.scheduling: Call TSBPE to schedule - tests given monthly in Austin
examination.retake_policy: Can retake after 30 days, unlimited attempts

application_process.title: Gather Experience Documentation
application_process.description: Get employer verification forms signed for all work experience. Need detailed hour breakdowns.

application_process.title: Submit Application
application_process.description: Complete online application or mail paper application with all supporting documents
application_process.timeline: Submit at least 45 days before desired test date

application_process.title: Application Approval
application_process.description: Board reviews and approves application. You'll receive approval letter with test authorization.

application_process.title: Schedule Exam
application_process.description: Call TSBPE to schedule your exam date. Bring required books and photo ID.

application_process.title: Take Exam
application_process.description: Open book exam at TSBPE headquarters in Austin. Results given immediately.

application_process.title: Pay License Fee & Receive License
application_process.description: If you pass, pay license activation fee. License card mailed within 2 weeks.

insurance_bonding.notes: Insurance/bonds not required for individual licensure, but may be required by employers or for contractor licenses

ce_providers: Approved by TSBPE - list on website
renewal.late_renewal: Can renew up to 2 years late with penalty fees

accepts_from: None - Texas does not have reciprocity agreements
reciprocity.endorsement_process: Out-of-state plumbers must meet Texas experience requirements and pass TX exam
reciprocity.notes: Texas has unique requirements - most states do not qualify for endorsement

pro_tips: Texas exams are OPEN BOOK - tab your code book extensively
Focus on knowing WHERE to find answers, not memorizing codes
The Texas Law section is NOT in the IPC - study the TSBPE rules booklet
Experience hours must be verified by a Texas-licensed Master Plumber
Apply 60 days before you want to test - processing takes time
Austin is the ONLY test location - plan travel if needed
common_pitfalls: Not having experience properly documented - get signatures BEFORE employer leaves
Thinking you can substitute education for experience - you cannot
Not bringing required code books to exam - you'll be turned away
Waiting until last minute to renew - can take 2 weeks to process
Not understanding that Texas doesn't recognize most out-of-state licenses
